com.jrefinery.chart
Class JFreeChart

com.jrefinery.chart.JFreeChart
All Implemented Interfaces:
LegendChangeListener, PlotChangeListener, TitleChangeListener
public class JFreeChart
implements TitleChangeListener, LegendChangeListener, PlotChangeListener

A chart class implemented using the Java 2D APIs. The current version supports bar charts, line charts, pie charts and xy plots (including time series data).

JFreeChart coordinates several objects to achieve its aim of being able to draw a chart on a Java 2D graphics device: a Title, a Legend, a Plot and a DataSource (the Plot in turn manages a horizontal axis and a vertical axis).

You should use JFreeChartPanel to display a chart in a GUI.

See Also:
JFreeChartPanel, Title, Legend, Plot, DataSource

Constructor Detail

JFreeChart

public JFreeChart(com.jrefinery.chart.Dataset data,
                  Plot plot)
Standard constructor: returns a chart for displaying a dataset.

Note that the ChartFactory class contains static methods that will return a ready-made chart.

Parameters:
data - The data to be represented in the chart.
plot - Controller of the visual representation of the data.

JFreeChart

public JFreeChart(com.jrefinery.chart.Dataset data,
                  Plot plot,
                  java.lang.String title,
                  java.awt.Font font,
                  boolean createLegend)
Standard constructor: returns a chart for displaying a dataset.

Note that the ChartFactory class contains static methods that will return a ready-made chart.

Parameters:
data - The data to be represented in the chart.
plot - Controller of the visual representation of the data.
title - The main chart title.
font - The font for displaying the chart title.
createLegend - Flag indicating whether or not a legend should be created for the chart.

public boolean getAntiAlias()
Returns a flag that indicates whether or not anti-aliasing is used when the chart is drawn.

A flag that indicates whether or not anti-aliasing is used when the chart is drawn.

setAntiAlias

public void setAntiAlias(boolean flag)
Sets a flag that indicates whether or not anti-aliasing is used when the chart is drawn.

Anti-aliasing can improve the appearance of charts.

Parameters:
flag - The new value of the flag.

getChartBackgroundPaint

Returns:
The color/shade used to fill the chart background.

setChartBackgroundPaint

public void setChartBackgroundPaint(java.awt.Paint paint)
Sets the color/shade used to fill the chart background. All registered listeners are notified that the chart has been changed.
Parameters:
paint - The new background color/shade.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                 java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D chartArea)
Draws the chart on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a printer).

This method is the focus of the entire JFreeChart library.

Parameters:
g2 - The graphics device.
chartArea - The area within which the chart should be drawn.

Parameters:
listener - The object being registered;

Deregisters an object for notification of changes to the chart.
Parameters:
listener - The object being deregistered.

fireChartChanged

protected void fireChartChanged()
Sends a default ChartChangeEvent to all registered listeners.

This method is for convenience only.

Sends a ChartChangeEvent to all registered listeners.
Parameters:
event - Information about the event that triggered the notification.

datasetChanged

public void datasetChanged(com.jrefinery.chart.DatasetChangeEvent event)
Receives notification of a change to the plot's dataset.

The chart reacts by passing on a chart change event to all registered listeners.

Parameters:
event - Information about the event (not used here).
